title: Virgin Money surprises by announcing first dividend
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Virgin Money surprises by announcing first dividend Virgin Money, run by Jayne-Anne Gadhia, reported strong growth in the mortgage market Nigel Roddis/Reuters Katherine Griffiths Banking Editor Published at 12:01AM, July 29 2015 
Virgin Money surprised investors with a maiden dividend and revealed strong growth in the mortgage market. The challenger bank predicted that profit margins might rise in the intensely competitive mortgage market in the second half of the year. It added that it was well placed to develop its credit card business so that it was not so reliant on 0 per cent balance transfers for growth. 
Virgin Money, which floated last November, reported a 37 per cent jump in first-half profit to £82 million, sending its shares up by nearly 11 per cent to close at 415p.
